title: What's the most ridiculous gadget in Batman's arsenal? - Quora

response.answer_text: His Red Giants.  “You like the knuckles, Clark. Each pod contains microscopic red suns, collected from dead solar systems.” It also makes this panel funny in hindsight.  “Our applied sciences division has been working on a clean, renewable energy source.” Batman can literally harvest entire red giant (dwarf?) stars in deep space, shrink them down and bring them to Earth, and he’s still struggling to find clean, renewable energy?! Wasn’t that what Doctor Octopus was trying and failing to do in Spider-Man 2?  Even tiny, they would produce heat and energy through the process of fusion.  “10 trillion years…” Batman: "I can shrink down entire red dwarf stars, bring them to Earth and contain them safely, and yet the only thing I can think to use them for is brass knuckles to hit Clark with when he's Jokerized. To hell with solving the world’s energy crisis."

Bat-Shark Repellent:  In 1966's Batman: The Movie, Batman was hanging from his Bat-Copter on a rope ladder when a shark clamped onto his leg. At that point, Batman called out to Robin to hand him a can of Bat-Shark Repellent. That means, at some point, Batman thought to himself, "There will come a day when a shark will bite me and I can't just punch or stab it. No, I want to spray it." That's when he came up with an aerosol can of Bat-Shark Repellent. What makes it even worse is that he didn't keep it in his Bat-boat where it would make sense, but rather on his Bat-copter, along with cans of other sea life-repellent like barracuda-repellent and whale-repellent. That took up the valuable room he could have used for something else, but it paid off. this is most ridiculous gadget in Batman's arsenal in my opinion.
